contents.raw_html_text:
Coffee Pot Cellars

A small-production winery producing five wines, Merlot, Meritage, Chardonnay, Gewurztraminer and Sauvignon Blanc, with a tasting room in Cutchogue.


Harbes Farm and Winery

A farm, vineyard, and tasting room located 715 Sound Ave in Mattituck, NY. The tasting rooms in a restored barn and the only place where the wine produced from the 5 acres of vineyards can be bought. The Harbes have owned and operated the farm for 13 generations, and now has many animals to visit, produce to buy, and apples to be picked.


Greenport Harbor Brewing Company

Located in nearby Greenport, the Greenport Harbor Brewing company serves its own beers brewed in house.

Catapano Farms

33705 North Road Peconic, NY 11958

This farm is home to more than 80 goats, who produce award winning cheese and skin care products. Run by Michael Catapano and his wife Karen, this farm is one of the most respected goat cheese operations in the country.


8 Hands Farm

Located on 28 acres, 8 Hands Farm is a sustainable family farm with animals and vegetables. There is an on-site farm store to purchase grass-fed meats, pastured eggs, cheese, produce, and fiber products from the family’s Icelandic sheep.


Sang Lee Farm

This farm was started in the 1940’s, when George Kim Lee returned home from the Navy in WWII. The farm initially supplied New York’s Chinatown with Asian produce. Soon the farm was serving Asian markets from Montreal to Miami. Now the farm continues to grow Asian produce, but also heirloom tomatoes, herbs and greens. They sell at their farm stand, as well as farmer’s markets around Long Island and through a CSA.

Orient Beach State Park

Orient Beach State Park is located on the Eastern tip of Long Island along Gardiner's Bay. Containing a salt water marsh, marine wildlife, and many birds, this park is enjoyed by those who wish to hike, bike, swim, fish, or kayak.


North Fork County Park

Located down the road from Hallock State Park, the North Fork County Park contains nature trails and woods.


North Fork Audubon Society

The Long Island chapter of the National Audubon Society works to connect people with nature by stewarding the Inlet Pond County Park, creating and maintaining trails and demonstration gardens.

The Riverhead Ciderhouse

Serving apple ciders, local beers and wines, the ciderhouse is dedicated to researching and developing cider brands from New York State. The café serves fresh and local ingredients, making pizzas, sandwiches, and other dishes.


Lovelane Kitchen

Traditional American food served for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner. With local wines and beers.

North Fork Bed and Breakfast Association

North Fork Bed and Breakfast Association is a directory for the inns on the East End of Long Island, NY, which can help to describe and book accommodation at the B&Bs in the area. The directory can be found at http://www.nfbba.org/.


Shorecrest B&B

54300 Route 48 , Southold, NY 11971 USA

This bed and breakfast was originally a summer house for a wealthy New Jersey Doctor, but has since been converted to a bed and breakfast with five rooms and five beach houses, all on private beaches of the Long Island Sound and the Bay.


The Wickham Prince B&B

1100 Youngs Ave Southold, NY 11971

Within walking distance of the Southold village, the Wickham Prince B&B has two rooms to choose from. The house was originally built around 1897, but has been updated with all modern amenities.

Hallockville Museum Farm

Situated on the Hallock Homestead, first built in 1765, this museum is organized to preserve and interpret the history of farming on the North Fork of Long Island. With rotating exhibits in the preserved house and homestead of the Hallock family.


Located next door to the park, the Hallockville Museum holds events and possesses a large collection displaying the historical and agricultural life of the area.


Southold Indian Museum

This museum is owned and operated by the Long Island Chapter of the New York State Archaeological Association. It is dedicated to studying and providing education about the archaeology of the surrounding area, including Native American artifacts.


Antique Power Association Museum

This club of old iron collectors first began to display antique trucks and tractors for a parade, and has expanded to a pan-Long Island traveling exhibit with plans for a permanent museum.


Suffolk County Historical Society

This museum was founded in 1886 just after the Civil War when inhabitants of Suffolk County became concerned that if they did not preserve their history it would be lost. The museum, library, and archives work to preserve the history of Suffolk county and it’s people by housing over 20,000 artifacts and holding educational events.
